seasonal: April is historically the most positive month of the year for oil. Seasonal bias is strongly bullish.

statistics.description: Over the last 30 years, oil rose around April 2 approximately 71% of the time.
Over the last 30 years, oil rose around April 22 approximately 76% of the time.
Over the last 30 years, oil rose around April 28 approximately 70% of the time.
Over the last 30 years, oil closed higher on April 14 than on April 1 in 77% of cases (23 out of 30 times).

insights: When there are three turning point dates in oil and they are close together, it indicates one of two things: high volatility during the month between the dates, and/or sometimes one or two dates may be missing.
Oil has consistently provided significant moves between cycle turning dates over recent months, with cumulative moves over 100% in accumulated movements.

The effectiveness of the turning point dates is clearly reflected in the last seven months' performance: February ~13.5%, January >20%, December ~12%, November ~11.5%, October ~20%, September ~32%, August ~30%.
Despite not being able to capture every market move, precise and measured utilization of even one asset (out of the five in the report) over a few months can produce phenomenal results.

The price of oil in April 2025 is nearly identical to its price in August 2024. Despite the ups and downs, working with cycle-based timing allows identification of trading opportunities regardless of overall direction.
When price approaches a significant support area, the combination of the turning point date and technical alignment with the dominant trend direction gives the highest success probability.
The $62.50-$65.50 support zone on the weekly chart has held firmly for three years and provides a reliable floor.
Daily chart shows a broadening range/consolidation pattern with opportunities for short trades within the resistance zone of $71.50-$73.00 when combined with turning point dates.

support.description: Major weekly support zone that has held for three years. Any test of this level is likely to produce a bounce.
Lower boundary of daily consolidation range and key intraday support.
Previous resistance zone now acting as support after reclaim.

resistance.description: Key daily resistance/consolidation zone. Price is hovering between $71.50 and $73.00 with potential for breakout or rejection.
Resistance level on daily chart - clearing this would suggest further upside.
Next major resistance zone on weekly chart based on Fibonacci retracement levels.
Weekly chart resistance area - Fibonacci and prior pivot zone.

technical.indicators: Weekly chart shows significant support zone at $62.50-$65.50 unbroken for three years. The daily chart displays a broad consolidation pattern (choppy range) with the 200-day moving average acting as overhead resistance. The overall trend on the daily is neutral-to-mildly-bearish but with potential for short-term upside, especially from the key support zone combined with turning point dates. Support and resistance zones from the daily chart are clearly visible on the attached charts.

summary: Oil has the strongest seasonal bias of all assets in April (historically the most bullish month of the year). Combined with statistical probabilities of 70-77% for rises and two weekly cycle endings around April 11 and April 18, the first half of the month is expected to be notably positive. Key support at $62.50-$65.50 (3-year weekly support) provides a reliable floor, while resistance at $71.50-$73.00 on the daily chart must be cleared for further upside toward $77.55-$80.00.
previous_month_review: In March 2025 there were three turning point dates. For the first time in several months, only one turning point date worked to produce a clear trend reversal. March 6 (arrived exactly on time, slightly one day early): marked the low of the decline from the previous February cycle and triggered a ~4% rally to the next date. March 21: did not provide the expected reversal - merely halted the upward movement for one day then broke higher, becoming a continuing cycle. March 28: the upward price movement stopped upon reaching this date, but on the last day of the month (March 31) it broke upward, also becoming a continuing cycle.
risk_notes: Despite the bullish seasonal setup, oil remains highly sensitive to geopolitical events and OPEC decisions.
When operating with cycle-based timing in a passive investment, the ability to identify opportunities both long and short makes real profit possible regardless of direction.
This method combines patience with precision - not every date will produce a trade, but when dates align with technical levels and trend, the results compound.
Two weekly cycles end this month (around April 11 and April 18). Both dates should be watched carefully as they may generate more significant-than-usual volatility.
In all cases, each turning point date may provide a turning point in the trend, but be prepared for heightened volatility around these dates.
